main event: An unidentified object resembling a bright evening star was observed over Washington, D.C. on August 4, 1954.
interesting points: The object was seen changing colors slightly and appeared semi-circular when viewed through binoculars., It was observed over a period of 1.3 hours., The object traveled from south to northwest, apparently at mid-afternoon speed., The observation was made at around 0210 EST and the object disappeared around 0239 EST., It's notably reported that Mars was setting at the time of disappearance, suggesting a possible reference point for the observers.
witness description: Miss [REDACTED] and Mr. [REDACTED] from Washington, D.C.
